intro: Epilobium × brittonii, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the genus Epilobium, which includes numerous species of flowering plants in the family Onagraceae. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows, streambanks, and roadside areas. Epilobium × brittonii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
